title: Lessons From Headshot Land: Expanding to Portrait Photography
summary: Peter Hurley addresses the Headshot Crew community after their first year, announcing a strategic expansion from strictly headshot photography into broader portraiture. He explains how headshot techniques apply to all portraits and outlines a new educational track designed to help photographers diversify their portfolios.

steps.action: Reflect on the first year of the Headshot Crew platform and its success as a niche community.
Define the relationship between headshots and portraits, noting that while headshots are portraits, the reverse isn't always true.
Explain that techniques learned for headshots (positioning, expression coaching) are valid for any human subject, regardless of distance from the camera.
Introduce the new 'Portrait Track' for the upcoming year, starting with material from the Headshot Intensive Online.
Call for community participation to share portrait shoots, ask questions, and inspire one another to build diverse portfolios.

key_takeaways: Headshot photography techniques are directly transferable to general portraiture.
Diversifying portfolios beyond headshots can lead to commercial and editorial opportunities.
Community engagement and shared learning are essential for professional growth in photography.
